Celebrating International Womenâ€™s Day

By Hannah Boyle

Orla McAndrew reflects on this important day and speaks to other editors and writers about who inspires them

Beth Jeans

Beth Jeans Houghton, a 21-year-old guitarist and singer-songwriter from Newcastle, played the Duchess early October to a small but appreciative crowd: composed in no small part of friends of Houghton and the support acts though also containing a few clearly rapt BJH devotees

Melancholia

Anticipating a sci-fi heavy film a la Armageddon, my expectations were not met. They were surpassed. Visually stunning and emotionally draining, Lars von Trier's Melancholia delivers with this apocalyptic drama.

Smoking - Certificate 18

New research has suggested that films featuring cigarettes are unsuitable for teenagers. Vicky Morris asks whether such proposals are worth listening to.

Drive

Ryan Gosling gives a stand-out performance in Danish director Nicolas Winding Refn's latest offering.

Friends With Benefits

<em>Friends with Benefits</em> has come to our screens not long after the <em>No Strings Attached</em>, concerning itself with the same subject and in actual fact seeming to follow an almost identical plot

Stephen Merchant

Stephen Merchant talks to James Dixon about American vs British comedy, working in TV, and the rock'n'roll life on the road days before his stand up show <em>Hello Ladies</em> reaches York's Grand Opera House

Tyrannosaur

Disturbing, brutal and incredibly moving, Tyrannosaur fearlessly exposes the unseen and accepted violence of the everyday. Rating: ****

Midnight in Paris

<em>Midnight in Paris</em> transports us back to a decadent, sumptuous era in a fantasy transferred elegantly into reality: Woody Allen's fantasy, to be exact

Crazy, Stupid, Love

Even if it's occasionally formulaic, with a couple of genuinely good twists and turns, and the ambition of its multi-generational story <em>Crazy, Stupid, Love </em>, is thoroughly entertaining

LFW Interview with... Francesca Marotta

By James Bithell

Nouse were lucky enough to catch up with designer Francesca Marotta after going to her show during London Fashion Week. (Thumbnail credit Photography : P Surys Assistant : Manos Katsaprinis)

Izmaylova Spring/Summer '12

By James Bithell

Izmaylova's latest collection titled 'The Edge of Ice', made models in to Ice Queens on the catwalk.

LFW Interview: Adam J W Smith

We take a look beneath the clothes and catch up with one of Britain's top male models.

Francesca Marotta Spring/Summer '12

Nouse reviews Francesca Marotta's debut collection titled 'A la Recherche du temps perdu', the searching of lost time.

LFW Interview: Thomas Blakk

Luxury handbag designer, Thomas Blakk, chats to Nouse about his unique designs and going Gaga

LFW Interview with... Malene Oddershede Bach

It is not often you talk to a hot new designer about mouse intestines and touching butterfly wings, but Nouse did just that when catching up with Malene Oddershede Bach

LFW Interview with... Carlotta Gherzi

Body con mixed with free flowing shapes, add in exceptional print work, it must be Carlotta Gherzi's latest collection (Thumbnail credit Photo credit: Emma Block)

LFW Interview with... Jungeun Lee

Fashion comes in all shapes and sizes. Jungeun Lee explains why her creations require no sewing or pattern cutting

LFW Interview with... Masc

Nouse looks behind the Masc and talks to the design duo on their latest collection.

Joanne Hynes spring/summer '12

Joanne Hynes presents a show of colour explosion and futuristic elements. (Thumbnail credit Philippa Grafton)

In Pictures: LFW Day Five

Highlights of London Fashion Week Day 5, as photographed by Philippa Grafton

Elisa Palomino spring/summer '12

Elisa Palomino creates victorian fairytales using lace, sequins and fishnet. (Thumbnail credit Philippa Grafton)

60 seconds with... Tommy Lloyd-Barker

Facepaint extraordinaire, Tommy Lloyd-Baker spends 60 seconds telling us why he paints his face. (Thumbnail credit Philippa Grafton)

A la Disposition spring/summer '12

A La Disposition construct their way to mechanical failure. (Thumbnail credit Philippa Grafton)

Fashion Shenzhen spring/summer '12

Oriental colour and patterns bring out the best of fashion at Fashion Shenzhen. (Thumbnail credit Philippa Grafton)

Christian Blanken spring/summer '12

Christian Blanken creates clothes with attitude in a presentation full of mirrors. (Thumbnail credit Philippa Grafton)

In Pictures: LFW Day Four

60 seconds with... Lynsie Roberts

Freelance photographer, Lynsie from Toronto, chats to us about British fashion.

60 seconds with... Victoria Cumming

Victoria Cumming is the PR Manager at Erickson Beamon, she tells us about her new collection in 60 seconds. (Thumbnail credit Philippa Grafton)

Ashley Isham spring/summer '12

Sparkles and gold set off Ashley Isham's spring/summer '12 collection (Thumbnail credit Ama Samra)

60 seconds with... Lolly Stockwell

Simone Rocha shows her first solo collection in London and we chat to her PR assistant about the pieces and her favourite outfits. (Thumbnail credit Philippa Grafton)
